lenders.name: Binh
lenders.occupational_info: Born and raised in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Binh witnessed the challenges of economic development and social inequality at an early age, and often thought about how to make a difference in the world. After receiving a B.A. in Political Science at the University of Pennsylvania, he pursued his interest in social entrepreneurship by moving to Phnom Penh, Cambodia and working with an agricultural micro-franchise that is incubated within iDE (International Development Enterprises). When Binh traveled to rural provinces to meet farmer clients, he found that many smallholder farmers lack access to capital in order to buy basic items such as high-quality seeds or fertilizers. This realization piqued his interest in microfinance as a method of empowering entrepreneurs to tackle poverty in a sustainable manner. As a Fellow in the Philippines, Binh looks forward to working with Kiva’s partners and honing his Tagalog. A foodie at heart, he also hopes to eat as much street food as possible in Bacolod, Tagbilaran, and Cabanatuan!

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: For several years, I have known a lady who came here as a refugee from Africa. This  friendship has opened my eyes to the vastness of human need in Africa and  around the world.   As a retired RN, basically a lifelong caregiver,   I want & need to continue helping others. This is a way for someone on a fixed income to help, by  loaning small amounts at a time.  I am really pleased to be part of this movement.
lenders.occupational_info: I loved working as an RN for 43 years, latterly 22 years in geriatrics, which brought increased knowledge of psychological and mental issues.  In retirement, I miss the camaraderie of our nursing staff.   Now my focus is on my grandchildren, 2 of whom have  special needs - all of them keep my life interesting (I have learned a lot of things I hadn't planned on) LOL!!  I can finally spend more time on my family genealogy and my stamp collection.

lenders.name: Live Life Unbound Community
lenders.loan_because: To create a foundation of support toward the global rise of women.
lenders.occupational_info:
VISION

We envision a world unbound from the conventional definition of “work.”  We visualize a future of globally interconnected entrepreneurs dependent upon online personal relationships to achieve mutually beneficial results.  We believe that women entrepreneurs will lead the way for this paradigm change and we seek to be the agents of change to make this future happen.

MISSION QUESTION

How can we help women small business entrepreneurs design online marketing systems built on engagement and personal connection to organically grow their base and live a life unbound?

BUSINESS PHILOSOPHY & CLIENT SATISFACTION

Unbound Virtual Administrators aims to have a wealth of experiences in life and make a conscious effort to connect, collaborate, and encourage creativity, honesty, and clarity between all peoples.  We believe in adventure, excitement, engagement, giving back to the community, and committing ourselves to meaningful work.
